SENT.plain: Combined palsies of cranial nerves, especially of the oculomotor nerves, are distinctly uncommon, even in patients with diabetes mellitus
We present a patient with type 2 diabetes mellitus, arterial hypertension and hyperlipidaemia, who had simultaneous oculomotor and trochlear nerve palsies
An MRI scan showed multiple brainstem ischaemic infarcts
The patient was treated with intensified insulin regimen and clopidogrel
Symptoms gradually improved, and at 9 months there was no further improvement
